snippet.textDisplay: Thank you for teaching a general biology professor about the new type of vaccine. Pretty good summary on mRNA function. It's a little slice of the explanation of the Central Dogma of Biology. mRNA is the "middle man" or "messenger" molecule that carries information from the Cell's DNA in order to make any needed proteins. Viruses are able to replicate because they hi-jack this system. You probably have your source of science consultants, but you should consider doing mini-collabs with folks like Hank Green and Co., or other PBS channels like "I contain multitudes" or "It's okay to be smart." </inserting slip into suggestion box>

snippet.textDisplay:
Hey Phil, I watched a BBC news report on the economic impact on Dutch flower growers.
Want a challenge?
Do you think it would be possible to do a 12 minute video on what effect the pandemic and various public responses to it have had on global and personal finance?

Good, level headed, sensible piece as always. I for one appreciated this journalism. Nice one mate.

snippet.authorDisplayName: Jai Cilento I LoveThatGuy ʕ•ᴥ•ʔߛ ̋ l Verified l
snippet.textDisplay:
☼ Do you know what would be nice: reports of those infected who cleared the virus, not just those infected? And a reminder that just as those not tested may have had the virus, so too are they likely too healthy to report for testing - thats why they wern't tested. And the sales of vaccine/development is not an issue, if the government runs that section of healthcare. Or all healthcare.


At a certain point, treatment deaths vs c-19 deaths should be reported now as well. And reporting on both post infection and post vaccine (bc they use similar moas) syndromes long term could use an eye, as the years unfold. Of course, my heart goes out to any profit loss by those companies - all of which have fascinating vaccine stories of their own (or no approved background in them at all, but this isnt my video). But it is important not to be shamed out of asking journalistic questions, and remembering both how dangerous this is - and is not.


Im not saying ever let a good disaster go to waste, but If we weren't quarantining every year as a norm, there is more to this story yet. gr8 vid.
snippet.textOriginal:
☼ Do you know what would be nice: reports of those infected who cleared the virus, not just those infected? And a reminder that just as those not tested may have had the virus, so too are they likely too healthy to report for testing - thats why they wern't tested. And the sales of vaccine/development is not an issue, if the government runs that section of healthcare. Or all healthcare. 


At a certain point, treatment deaths vs c-19 deaths should be reported now as well. And reporting on both post infection and post vaccine (bc they use similar moas) syndromes long term could use an eye, as the years unfold. Of course, my heart goes out to any profit loss by those companies - all of which have fascinating vaccine stories of their own (or no approved background in them at all, but this isnt my video). But it is important not to be shamed out of asking journalistic questions, and remembering *both* how dangerous this is - *and is not.* 


Im not saying ever let a good disaster go to waste, but If we weren't quarantining every year as a norm, there is more to this story yet. gr8 vid.

snippet.textDisplay:
Next month is going to be a crossroads for humanity. If remdesivir clinical trials yield as positive a result as a lot of the earlier tests showed in Asia, we will all be getting back to work sooner rather than later. Yea, people will still get sick, but we will have an antiviral that will keep hospitals from reaching capacity and the curve won't spike. Kinda how tamiflu keeps you home recovering from the flu rather than in a hospital bed.

If the clinical trials are a failure....... well say bye bye to the economy and hello to blood in the streets. Governments will be forced to decide between two things. Do we send people back to work and deal with increased Coronavirus deaths? Or do we keep everyone on lockdown and deal with increased deaths from rioting, looting and the complete collapse of society. What we are doing now is simply not sustainable for 18 months or more, as some experts are predicting.
snippet.textOriginal:
Next month is going to be a crossroads for humanity. If remdesivir clinical trials yield as positive a result as a lot of the earlier tests showed in Asia, we will all be getting back to work sooner rather than later. Yea, people will still get sick, but we will have an antiviral that will keep hospitals from reaching capacity and the curve won't spike. Kinda how tamiflu keeps you home recovering from the flu rather than in a hospital bed. 

If the clinical trials are a failure....... well say bye bye to the economy and hello to blood in the streets. Governments will be forced to decide between two things. Do we send people back to work and deal with increased Coronavirus deaths? Or do we keep everyone on lockdown and deal with increased deaths from rioting, looting and the complete collapse of society. What we are doing now is simply not sustainable for 18 months or more, as some experts are predicting.

snippet.textDisplay: Medications are used off label all the time. There is absolutely no reason to grant FDA approval to hydroxychloroquine for treatment of COVID-19. The data is limited and does not meet criteria for FDA approval. That doesn’t mean that hydroxychloroquine can’t be used for treatment of COVID-19. Since options are so limited at this time, I expect that this treatment option is being offered to patients.

snippet.textDisplay:
Phil could you please cover DissociaDid & Trisha Paytas & Anthony situation on Youtube?

There is a community of vulnerable, but very BRAVE and people who share their Dissociative Identity Disorder journeys, information, scientific realities, trauma insights etc...

Trisha has gone after one particular channel/grouping named DissociaDid attacking them and terrorizing them in her content, and equally attacking and terrorizing others who are struggling with this mental illness, spreading false and harmful information, as well as upsetting many in the Youtube community.

The information that Anthony Padilla has chosen to share, and allow awareness to a broader audience about D.I.D. matters, and is important. The information that DissociaDID so carefully and intently shares and brings forward to dispel stigma, limitations, confusions, misunderstandings etc.. surrounding this mental disorder MATTERS.

There are clear signs that Trisha is hopping on a very unfortunate bandwagon of working with trending topics, then claiming she is connected into them.

Well what happens when Youtubers use severe mental health disorders as crutches to get views, and equally use that angle to bully and terrorize other youtubers who are beacons for this disorder?

Please, if you can cover this, it would be deeply appreciated, not only to support those in the community who ARE brave enough to share such raw, and intimate content such as their mental health realities- but also because what is happening here is so beyond disturbing and disappointing too to see vulnerable but VITAL subgroupings of Youtubers being attacked and labelled crazy.
snippet.textOriginal:
Phil could you please cover DissociaDid & Trisha Paytas & Anthony situation on Youtube?

There is a community of vulnerable, but very BRAVE and people who share their Dissociative Identity Disorder journeys, information, scientific realities, trauma insights etc...

Trisha has gone after one particular channel/grouping named DissociaDid attacking them and terrorizing them in her content, and equally attacking and terrorizing others who are struggling with this mental illness, spreading false and harmful information, as well as upsetting many in the Youtube community.

The information that Anthony Padilla has chosen to share, and allow awareness to a broader audience about D.I.D. matters, and is important. The information that DissociaDID so carefully and intently shares and brings forward to dispel stigma, limitations, confusions, misunderstandings etc.. surrounding this mental disorder MATTERS.

There are clear signs that Trisha is hopping on a very unfortunate bandwagon of working with trending topics, then claiming she is connected into them.

Well what happens when Youtubers use severe mental health disorders as crutches to get views, and equally use that angle to bully and terrorize other youtubers who are beacons for this disorder?

Please, if you can cover this, it would be deeply appreciated, not only to support those in the community who ARE brave enough to share such raw, and intimate content such as their mental health realities- but also because what is happening here is so beyond disturbing and disappointing too to see vulnerable but VITAL subgroupings of Youtubers being attacked and labelled crazy.

snippet.textDisplay:
A note on hydroxychloroquine -
As well as being an anti-malarial, it is also used for managing chronic autoimmune conditions like lupus. Since it was announced that it may be widely used in treating coronavirus, prices have risen dramatically (around 3000% according to one pharmacist), and many patients are simply unable to get hold of their medication. I'm in the UK and haven't had to refill my prescription since the outbreak here, so I can't speak from experience. However, I am classed as high risk for severe consequences from covid-19 (having already had sepsis from a fairly innocuous virus), and this risk will be further increased if I am unable to take my daily hydroxychloroquine, so I am concerned. The same will be true of many other people, who (unrelated to coronavirus) may suffer serious health complications such as organ failure if their condition is not managed.
While I welcome the potential treatment for coronavirus and hope that it is able to aid recovery and save lives, I truly hope that issues in the supply chain are resolved and prices controlled - for the benefit both of those suffering from covid-19, and those of us who rely on the medicine in our daily lives.
As always, thank you for the video - really informative and helpful.
snippet.textOriginal:
A note on hydroxychloroquine - 
As well as being an anti-malarial, it is also used for managing chronic autoimmune conditions like lupus. Since it was announced that it may be widely used in treating coronavirus, prices have risen dramatically (around 3000% according to one pharmacist), and many patients are simply unable to get hold of their medication. I'm in the UK and haven't had to refill my prescription since the outbreak here, so I can't speak from experience. However, I am classed as high risk for severe consequences from covid-19 (having already had sepsis from a fairly innocuous virus), and this risk will be further increased if I am unable to take my daily hydroxychloroquine, so I am concerned. The same will be true of many other people, who (unrelated to coronavirus) may suffer serious health complications such as organ failure if their condition is not managed. 
While I welcome the potential treatment for coronavirus and hope that it is able to aid recovery and save lives, I truly hope that issues in the supply chain are resolved and prices controlled - for the benefit both of those suffering from covid-19, and those of us who rely on the medicine in our daily lives.
As always, thank you for the video - really informative and helpful.

snippet.textDisplay:
People started talking about the drug hydroxychloroquine a.k.a. Plaqueinil I wondered why it sounded familiar. I now have five autoimmune diseases as of Friday, March 20 being diagnosed with PPP yesterday sadly but the weird thing of that was it is that it’s a very rare autoimmune disease and the fact that I’ve never been a smoker to get it. It’s a smokers disease and I’ve never been able to smoke let alone become a smoker so to get this I’m on the fence it could be a third misdiagnosis in a month which doesn’t surprise me anymore when I’m beyond doctors and specialists knowledge and capabilities. But because I have other autoimmune diseases I’m at higher risk to continue to get more autoimmune diseases and be immune compromised so it’s just hitching a ride like the others.
My main point is long but I’ve learned more with social media how many relate that have auto immune diseases than I ever knew prior to social media but I was in my early 20s and a MBA college grad when social media came to existence same with the iPhone, but I was diagnosed with JRA in 1994 at the age of 10 and was subsequently treated for 2 1/2 almost 3 years until it went into remission by itself. the original treatment was give myself 800 mg of ibuprofen twice a day which started to eat the crap out of my stomach and I was missing school because I was vomiting so they went on to other drugs which included taking the a.k.a. Plaqunil for about six months back then between my 6th to 8th grade years is when this spanned over when I was on non-traditional school time here in California. I also was actually excluded from having PE classes despite as a requirement in school I wasn’t allowed whatsoever, I was exempt, I couldn’t participate while out of remission.
Technically I’ve had this disease since I was born but it didn’t come out of remission until 1994. that being said around 12/13 years of age it went into remission out of no where on its own for almost 19 years until I was 31 years old which just 3 1/2 years ago it came out of remission. after I had a year of dealing with a new autoimmune disease called Addison’s disease, in which I was having treatment and monitored weekly like a hawk. Doctors think this caused my JRA to come out of remission. Except this time was completely different than any other time before with my extreme dance classes and performance Polynesian group and gym activity through my 20s I was getting my knee drained several times a year due to its swelling but remained in remission which is where it was originally discovered and tested from. I had a golf ball of fluid on my knee at 10, the doctor drained it, tested it and that’s where it was discovered in 1994. This time from day 1, my JRA was so horrific and just a couple weeks later, I was put on biological autoimmune chemotherapy treatments (aka chemotherapy) in the oncology department and sadly despite their optimism of only being on it for two years (their original plan timeline made out for me was useless by 18 months) and going back in remission. this disease has had other ideas where 3 1/2 years later I’m still getting That treatment in oncology every 2 to 4 weeks depending upon the drug, getting weekly methotrexate shots and daily pills of supplements that these naturally kill off and must be maintained daily to be at a semi normal level and eating certain foods won’t get me there with gastroparisis it could take a few days to absorb the nutrients versus pills and shots to get them in my system.
I’ve now been on four different drugs in the past year because some plateaued some overworked and we’re killing me some didn’t work at all and I was in so much pain and suffering to this new drug where I just got it last Tuesday but it makes people like me, usually autoimmune compromised having one disease out of remission being on chemotherapy but having 4 subsequent auto immune diseases weather there in remission or active which in the past 12 months I went from having 2 autoimmune diseases to adding 3 more from nowhere, the third one being added yesterday making a total of 5 diagnosed for me right now (4 proven with tests and this 5th because it’s on my skin and looks like other things we haven’t nailed a disease down 100%.)
Because it’s quarantine time and everybody’s making jokes I just turned into making jokes about collecting auto immune diseases and have fun with this. Having to have these for the rest of my life because they have no cure and some barely treatment with only one option and if that doesn’t work you’re SOL. The autoimmune diseases field have no cure on the planet, there is no vaccine and it’s basically just treatment and fighting with everything they can give you and your fighting will to live through it daily is life and everyday life.
when you come out of remission to give you some sort of a quality of life which technically isn’t one at all that you can kind a live with but from my past 3 1/2 years my parents have been joking that I’ve already been living in quarantine because that’s been my life, I haven’t been able to go to events or be around big crowds or groups of more than 5 people because of having no immunity protection so every time I leave my doorstep I have to wear a special double for carbon filter mask that is made of cloth to reuse and just replace the filters. I either get people asking me where I got it from because they need it if I see them in oncology or the opposite of people running away for me in the store thinking that I am infectious and going to give them something when in reality I am protecting myself because anything they can give me like a cold they have for five days can put me in the hospital for five weeks trying to fight it off and the flu for three months so anything more is highly dangerous and that’s before Sirius pandemics come in to play. If somebody in the store I am at or building anywhere near me if they cough or sneeze and do it in a unsanitary unhygienic manner I have to take precautions with sanitizer spray and wipes around me and put disposable gloves on where they look at me like I’m crazy and I look at them like they’re disgusting for being so unsanitary and have no personal hygiene in public especially to have no disregard for the health and safety of other people and I’m supposed to be the crazy one no, i’m protecting myself in my life because the other people around me regardless of being a stranger having no care about my health and my health safety or they would’ve sneezed or coughed it appropriately and use the sanitizer or wipes or even a damn tissue. I can’t even put myself at risk for getting a cold or the flu and something like pneumonia that I had to start being vaccinated for when I came out of remission for this was pneumonia and Man those shots in your arm hurt worse than any vaccine I got as a child and it last for two days, the worst shot I ever get and this is somebody who gets labs drawn weekly, shots weekly and gets an IV stuck in them for treatments of 5 hours every 2-4 weeks depending on labs.
(then I get a needle stuck in me for my IV which can be anywhere from them hitting it the first time to having two people hit me five times and then end up putting it in my elbow because they couldn’t find another vein which when it’s your sole job all day long to work in the oncology infusion department to put IVs and people 8 hours a day every day of the week you should not be missing any IVs especially with that special IV infrared finder that shows you the persons entire vein structure wherever you put it over there skin and you still miss your job performance and capability should be re-evaluated and you should be sent to training if you repeatedly can’t do your job)
Its alot and there is no sugarcoating any of it so when these people are saying viruses I can really relate more than anybody as can my fellow auto immune disease fighters. We live with the uncertainty of is our body going to fail today, is our immune system going to collapse and not protect us. We can’t tell what the level of our auto immune system is every single day of the week.
I truly wish More people understood why people like us go through and why it is extremely important that people take this seriously and for the elderly because there immune system has weekend and for other people who have other conditions that week in there immune protection and for all the people who have autoimmune diseases that have compromised immune system’s dad wouldn’t protect us it’s the people who are healthy that can kill us and sadly it’s our job to not be around those people whatsoever in anyway shape or form because of that fact they completely disregard exposure and then think it’s OK for them to come around us when they have no care for themselves of being exposed and people like us cannot take a chance whatsoever. The karma that really sucks is those ignorant people thinking they won’t get it some well but more importantly is that those people will then give it to Friends of theirs that are immune compromised to family members to their parents if they’re older to their grandparents and likely will be the ones killing their family members because they were stupid and think it’s a hoax and parting was more necessary than their family members life or their friends life. This is actually a very serious matter and it’s not a joke it’s not a hoax and if it takes A close death to them to realize that then Carmas going to be a huge bitch to them.

I had a golf ball of fluid on my knee at 10, the doctor drained it, tested it and that’s where it was discovered in 1994. This time from day 1, my JRA was so horrific and just a couple weeks later, I was put on biological autoimmune chemotherapy treatments (aka chemotherapy) in the oncology department and sadly despite their optimism of only being on it for two years (their original plan timeline made out for me was useless by 18 months) and going back in remission. this disease has had other ideas where 3 1/2 years later I’m still getting That treatment in oncology every 2 to 4 weeks depending upon the drug, getting weekly methotrexate shots and daily pills of supplements that these naturally kill off and must be maintained daily to be at a semi normal level and eating certain foods won’t get me there with gastroparisis it could take a few days to absorb the nutrients versus pills and shots to get them in my system.
 I’ve now been on four different drugs in the past year because some plateaued some overworked and we’re killing me some didn’t work at all and I was in so much pain and suffering to this new drug where I just got it last Tuesday but it makes people like me, usually autoimmune compromised having one disease out of remission being on chemotherapy but having 4 subsequent auto immune diseases weather there in remission or active which in the past 12 months I went from having 2 autoimmune diseases to adding 3 more from nowhere, the third one being added yesterday making a total of 5 diagnosed for me right now (4 proven with tests and this 5th because it’s on my skin and looks like other things we haven’t nailed a disease down 100%.)
Because it’s quarantine time and everybody’s making jokes I just turned into making jokes about collecting auto immune diseases and have fun with this. Having to have these for the rest of my life because they have no cure and some barely treatment with only one option and if that doesn’t work you’re SOL. The autoimmune diseases field have no cure on the planet, there is no vaccine and it’s basically just treatment and fighting with everything they can give you and your fighting will to live through it daily is life and everyday life. 
when you come out of remission to give you some sort of a quality of life which technically isn’t one at all that you can kind a live with but from my past 3 1/2 years my parents have been joking that I’ve already been living in quarantine because that’s been my life, I haven’t been able to go to events or be around big crowds or groups of more than 5 people because of having no immunity protection so every time I leave my doorstep I have to wear a special double for carbon filter mask that is made of cloth to reuse and just replace the filters. I either get people asking me where I got it from because they need it if I see them in oncology or the opposite of people running away for me in the store thinking that I am infectious and going to give them something when in reality I am protecting myself because anything they can give me like a cold they have for five days can put me in the hospital for five weeks trying to fight it off and the flu for three months so anything more is highly dangerous and that’s before Sirius pandemics come in to play. If somebody in the store I am at or building anywhere near me if they cough or sneeze and do it in a unsanitary unhygienic manner I have to take precautions with sanitizer spray and wipes around me and put disposable gloves on where they look at me like I’m crazy and I look at them like they’re disgusting for being so unsanitary and have no personal hygiene in public especially to have no disregard for the health and safety of other people and I’m supposed to be the crazy one no, i’m protecting myself in my life because the other people around me regardless of being a stranger having no care about my health and my health safety or they would’ve sneezed or coughed it appropriately and use the sanitizer or wipes or even a damn tissue. I can’t even put myself at risk for getting a cold or the flu and something like pneumonia that I had to start being vaccinated for when I came out of remission for this was pneumonia and Man those shots in your arm hurt worse than any vaccine I got as a child and it last for two days, the worst shot I ever get and this is somebody who gets labs drawn weekly, shots weekly and gets an IV stuck in them for treatments of 5 hours every 2-4 weeks depending on labs. 
 (then I get a needle stuck in me for my IV which can be anywhere from them hitting it the first time to having two people hit me five times and then end up putting it in my elbow because they couldn’t find another vein which when it’s your sole job all day long to work in the oncology infusion department to put IVs and people 8 hours a day every day of the week you should not be missing any IVs especially with that special IV infrared finder that shows you the persons entire vein structure wherever you put it over there skin and you still miss your job performance and capability should be re-evaluated and you should be sent to training if you repeatedly can’t do your job) 
Its alot and there is no sugarcoating any of it so when these people are saying viruses I can really relate more than anybody as can my fellow auto immune disease fighters. We live with the uncertainty of is our body going to fail today, is our immune system going to collapse and not protect us. We can’t tell what the level of our auto immune system is every single day of the week. 
I truly wish More people understood why people like us go through and why it is extremely important that people take this seriously and for the elderly because there immune system has weekend and for other people who have other conditions that week in there immune protection and for all the people who have autoimmune diseases that have compromised immune system’s dad wouldn’t protect us it’s the people who are healthy that can kill us and sadly it’s our job to not be around those people whatsoever in anyway shape or form because of that fact they completely disregard exposure and then think it’s OK for them to come around us when they have no care for themselves of being exposed and people like us cannot take a chance whatsoever. The karma that really sucks is those ignorant people thinking they won’t get it some well but more importantly is that those people will then give it to Friends of theirs that are immune compromised to family members to their parents if they’re older to their grandparents and likely will be the ones killing their family members because they were stupid and think it’s a hoax and parting was more necessary than their family members life or their friends life. This is actually a very serious matter and it’s not a joke it’s not a hoax and if it takes A close death to them to realize that then Carmas going to be a huge bitch to them.

snippet.textDisplay: I have felt like there is almost too much info on covid 19 and I have been looking for almost all this info you talked about but was coming up with little to nothing because there is info over load. snippet.textDisplay: The spread of Covid-19 by water droplets in the air is dependent on the relative humidity and temperature of that air. When the air is dry and cold such as in a grocery store the water droplet falls slower and thus you are more likely to become infected. In warmer more humid conditions the drops fall faster and you are less likely to be infected by the virus. If you are in a cold, dry space along with people who have possibly been infected then you should take appropriate precautions knowing that this is a high risk environment. Ideally, in warm areas where air conditioners are in use the temperature would be set higher preventing the humidity from dropping. In cool areas the use of a humidifier alone should prove beneficial.
snippet.textOriginal: The spread of Covid-19 by water droplets in the air is dependent on the relative humidity and temperature of that air. If you are in a cold, dry space along with people who have possibly been infected then you should take appropriate precautions knowing that this is a high risk environment. Ideally, in warm areas where air conditioners are in use the temperature would be set higher preventing the humidity from dropping. In cool areas the use of a humidifier alone should prove beneficial.
